ratte 0.0.5

  • Reference

Prepare the sequences with repeat elements

Source: R/prepareAnnotations.R
prepareSeq.Rd

The function will extract the genomic annotations from TxDb object, extract the sequences from BSgenome object, and generate the annotation for repeat elements.

prepareSeq(genome, txdb, rmsk, peaks, minWidth = 31L, verbose = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

genome

A BSgenome object

txdb

A TxDb object

rmsk

The RepeatMasker GRanges object

peaks

An GRanges object to represent the peak list.

minWidth

Minimal width for the repeat elements in the intergenic annotation.

verbose

Print the message or not.

...

Not use.

Value

An DataFrame with seqname and their repeat element annotations

Examples

# library(AnnotationHub)
# ah <- AnnotationHub()
# (rmsk <- query(ah, c('RepeatMasker', 'Zebrafish')))
# rmsk <- rmsk[['AH98980']]
rmsk <- readRDS(system.file('extdata', 'danRer11_rmsk_chr25_sub.RDS',
                             package='ratte'))

library(BSgenome.Drerio.UCSC.danRer11) # for sequences
library(TxDb.Drerio.UCSC.danRer11.refGene) # for genomic annotation
prepareSeq(Drerio,
           TxDb.Drerio.UCSC.danRer11.refGene,
           rmsk)
